episode_summary: This episode covers a range of fascinating topics including the original director of 'Jaws' mistakenly referring to the shark as a whale, the practice of dropping train carriages at stations without stopping, birds in cages exhibiting migratory behavior, and the large amount of clothing left behind at the Boston Marathon's starting line.

facts.fact: The original director of 'Jaws' was a man called Richard Richards who was fired because he kept referring to the shark as a whale.
Until the 1960s, high speed trains in Britain would drop carriages off at stations that they weren't stopping at.
Birds in cages hop in the direction they're meant to be migrating.
Each year, 26 tons of clothing is left behind at the starting line of the Boston marathon.
